full_summary:
================

**Notice: Request for Standing Offer**

[Official logo of the government agency]

### Title
International In-Flight and Ground Handling Services for Aviation Fuel – Request for Standing Offer (RFSo)

### Tender details

* **Reference Number:** WS3677703663-Doc3771759639
* **Solicitation Number:** WS3677703663
* **Publication Date:** 30 November 2022
* **Tender Closing Date:** 10 January 2023 (14:00:00 hours)

### Subject Matter

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Department of National Defence (DND) invites qualified suppliers to respond to this Request for Standing Offer (RFSo) for International In-Flight and Ground Handling Services for Aviation Fuel.

### scopes of Work

The services required include:

* Into-plane and ground handling services for aviation fuel at various locations worldwide

### Regions

The services are required for the following regions:

* Caribbean
*Central America
* South America
*Asia
* United States of America
*Europe
*Africa

### Economic Considerations

This RFSO is open to all qualified suppliers who can meet the requirements of the solicitation document. The trade agreements mentioned in the appendix indicate the preferred trading relationships and terms that the Crown will use to evaluate offers.

### Contact information

For more information, please contact:

Pam Munz (SPAC/PSPC)
Email: [pam.munz@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:pam.munz@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
Phone: None
Fax: None
Address:



### Access to solicitation document

Potential suppliers can obtain the solicitation document from SAP Ariba, by visiting: [http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14776564](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14776564)

### Important Dates

The tender closing date is 10 January 2023. Responses received after this time will be rejected.

By publishing this notice, PSPC and DND are not committing to award a contract to a supplier or endorse any supplier. Please respect the submission deadlines and bid/no-bid timelines.

Also, the caller may want to keep in mind to keep reviewing for terms and conditions because the latter is very important. 



 Best regards.
